intro: Dissotis gilletii, commonly known as the golden groundcherry, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, edible berries that are often used in local cuisines. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Dissotis gilletii thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
